Author: Frantzy Pierribia
Review Text: I am so in love with this bread machine! I've been using it about once per week ever since. It's great for those moments when I want fresh bread but can't be bothered to make and bake it myself. It's really easy to clean, really easy to store, and it doesn't overheat. I can even leave the house for a few hours with it running, and there's a keep warm setting once the bread is made. Mind you, we pull out the loaf immediately so it doesn't go soggy :)

Author: Saeed Saleh
Review Text: Just like it looks! I purchased the silver one, and it does great! I do like the size; it's not too big and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. The bread came out great, and everything was easy to follow. On top of that, it included a recipe book to experiment if you're new to bread-making!

Author: MARCIA GIELLA
Review Text: I had the machine set up, unboxed, clean, and was making bread within 10 minutes. It had some really good basic recipes in that booklet, and it also happened to come with all the basic tools to get started. I baked French bread twice and it went perfectly well both times. I really like the light yellow color, and it's magnetic, so I just slapped a magnet to the side to keep the booklet handy. Great Christmas gift from my wife!

Author: Brittany Loerzel
Review Text: This tiny breadmaker fits perfectly in my tiny house. It bakes fantastic bread! I really noticed the gluten-free thing. I've made four loaves so far. I made a couple of adjustments to the recipe in the manual and came up with a lighter, airier gluten-free bread by adding another teaspoon of instant yeast (if you're sensitive to it, add more) and using straight gluten-free bread flour. I'm very pleased with this machine! It fits on a shelf where it won't take up the minimal counter space I have and out of the way when not in use. Just make sure you put the paddle in before you paddle, ha!

Author: Alla Grutman
Review Text: I am really happy with this machine! It's ultra quiet and performs like a champ. It's a piece of cake to clean, and it is so easy to make bread. And it packs in so many features. The delay baking option is one of the things I like the most. It's as simple as tossing all the ingredients in before I go to bed, and it's good to go when we wake up. Such a fantastic machine!

Review Text: You have some control — adjusting time for most settings, but baking is capped at 60 minutes. You can do that on most budget gear, anyway. I wrestled with this machine for months, assuming the issue was the recipe. But if you want gluten-free bread that's been fully baked through, you'll have to do so manually, restarting the baking cycle after the first cycle runs through.

Author: Lorenzo Rothschild
Review Text: This one makes the most beautiful loaf right in your very own kitchen! Pro Tip: Bring your own measuring tools, because, the plastic one-size-fits-all cup they give you is not worth the hassle. You'll see that liquids and dry ingredients do not measure the same way. The photo above is from their basic recipe, and the texture was so perfect that you won't want to make anything, and put anything, with it. Plus, its built-in double heater provides an incredible crust and a great crumb texture. I posted this on Facebook, and every single friend of mine was so intrigued! Tired of paying $5.45 for a half loaf of bread? This also stitched together your email, saving some bucks and yielding a far better output.

Author: carlos ruiz
Review Text: This bread machine was gifted to me last year and I've been using it for a little over a month and I LOVE it and highly recommend it! A little tip: when you've finished baking and want to turn off the warmer, press and hold, don't just press. The button does get a little hot so I use a hot pad or washcloth to do this. It won't scorch you, but it's not the best thing to touch barehanded. I love the silver stainless steel model and it looks great on my countertop in my small kitchen. It's not too big, so I can leave it out without it bothering me. Honestly, I cannot recommend this machine any more! If anything ever happens to it, I'd get another instantaneously. Now I'm never going back to life without a bread machine!

Author: Dedelind
Review Text: I've been making bread from scratch for 50 years. I also take my bread machine to festivals and share what I made! This is my third machine, and actually this is the best machine I used, to be honest. The first one I owned eventually wore out, and the fancy KBS model with its two paddles turned out to be a real disappointment. But this one? This one is pretty rugged and pretty durable. It's a much better design, it's easy to clean, and I can make three perfect loaves using different kinds of flour and different recipes. I love that it's square for sandwiches, and appreciate the choice of a two-pound loaf. And when it's working, it's so quiet. Truly the best I've ever had!

Author: Maria Arvi
Review Text: Now, this is a tough machine that works like a charm! The guidelines and recipes are super simple to follow. Do a little experimenting with the buttons and settings before you start baking. It does its job very well and works great. It does end up a bit noisy, though, so a little advice I got is to use it in a place where nobody else would mind your noise. And the scent of fresh bread wafts through the house! Overall, especially considering the unit price — it's a great desktop!

Review Text: I really love this little machine! It is super easy to use, a snap to clean up and it also looks great. I'd definitely rate it 5 stars for that. Otherwise, if you're comfortable with a little bit of experimentation in trying out new ones, I'd say get this bread maker without a doubt!

It's not that loud, so if I'm in another room, I can't hear it. If I need to add something, I just watch the time and set my own timer. I would definitely recommend this for bread making, not to mention the nice smell in your house!

Review Text: I looked at about 15 different bread machines to compare their sizes, prices and extra features other than just making bread. Setting the price aside, this machine can churn out three loaf sizes in around 3.2 hours. I've recorded all the different breads I've attempted so far, and I used the recipes from the machine for my first go-around with each one. This model is one I recommend highly, most if you like to tinker with a recipe a little. You won't be let down!

Author: Carrol knight
Review Text: I purchased this bread machine so I would know exactly what I have in my bread, and that it doesn't contain preservatives. Now, I'm baking a fresh loaf about every ten days or so, and I truly wish I had bought one sooner. It's really simple: Just toss in the ingredients, in the right order and in the right amounts, place the container in the machine, select your recipe and setting for the crust, press "START," and boom! In roughly 3.5 hours, my kitchen smells of fresh bread, and I have a warm loaf ready to go. I've even stopped buying bread from the store – I bake it myself! I highly advise this machine.

Author: Gregory Spurlock
Review Text: Generally this product does the excellent task. I've baked more than a dozen loaves, and they've all worked out reasonably well. As with anything, you're going to have some trial and error with the recipes. If you want to avoid warming up the liquid, instant yeast is most certainly preferable to active dry yeast. I am still working on my pizza dough game. The ceramic pan is a delightful touch, and guarantees the loaves come sliding out without any trouble each and every time.

Review Text: I grew up on a DAK Turbo Baker, that old-school bread machine, so I've got some long-standing experience baking bread. I like to bake my own bread from scratch without machine. Mine hasn't shifted around on the counter one drop but I did orient the cord so that it would unplug itself if it went sliding off. And just a warning — the Hitachi bread that comes out of these machines when it's fresh isn't bad at all, but it's not on the level of homemade bread, so just remember that!

Review Text: I'm currently having fun with this cheap bread machine that makes it possible for me to make my very own loaf.
